results.title: Water for Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service Productions and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Traces the development of Melbourne’s water supply and depicts the steps taken to augment the Thomson River Scheme Projection of requirements to the year 2000. Also shown is the building of the Upper Thomson construction township and the planning, engineering, and conservation requirements of such a major scheme. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service Productions and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works

results.title: Water for dry land
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”
The dependence of man upon his supply of water. The transformation of desert lands by controlling water supply is shown.

results.title: Water for a city
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Bruce Moir and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Contrasts the need and the scarcity of water in Australia with the high per capita consumption in our cities. Shows briefly the processes of water supply, pollution control, purification and the variety of uses to which water is put in a city. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Water erosion and waterlogging
results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Water erosion can result in the complete degradation of land by the removal of topsoils to expose infertile clay subsoils. The adoption of minimum tillage and other farm management techniques can lessen the risk of water erosion and improve farm productivity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Water conservation
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Guild House Films, David Cobham Productions, Film Producers Guild and Simon Campbell-Jones
results.brief_description: Explains the advantages to the farmer of having his own water conservation scheme. Shows how a small reservoir can be constructed to make water available for irrigation purposes during the summer. Hints are given on siting, selection of water source and use of plastic or waterproof linings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Cobham, Guild House Films, David Cobham Productions, Film Producers Guild and Simon Campbell-Jones

results.title: Water Babies
results.brief_description: Shows how to teach young children to control their breathing in water, how to teach them to float, kick their feet and use their arms, and then further develop their water skills. Children who have been properly and safely made aware of water are given the confidence everyone needs when learning to swim.

Children who have been properly and safely made aware of water are given the confidence everyone needs when learning to swim.

results.title: Water and romi = Air dan romi
results.creator_credit: S E T Film Workshop and Garin Nugroho
results.brief_description: This documentary was produced for the International Seminar on Water, held in Jakarta in December 1991 under the auspices of the Goethe Institute, Indonesia. Water mongers and river cleaners, amongst others, are interviewed in this look at life along the rivers and the worrying condition of water supply in the bustling city of Jakarta. The film was banned by Suharto’s New Order Government. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Water-polo teamwork
results.brief_description: Waterpolo is an exciting and skilful game to play and watch, particularly when players adopt an attacking approach. The basic offensive move in waterloo is to make a “break” on your opponent ie. to be a body length or more in front of him/her while swimming towards the goal. Various configurations are shown in this program, from simple one on one break, to complex manoeuvres. Demonstrations by 1984 Australian Waterpolo Squad.

results.title: Water-Polo Skills
results.brief_description: In the context of a game of water polo between two school boy teams, we see the fundamental skills to be mastered, including those of a goalkeeper. The skills are the water polo kick, swimming with the ball, and ways to pick the ball up, catching and passing, the roll, the tackle and pass, and five different shots for goal.
